intro: Goniothalamus philippinensis var. philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine mountain ash, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its compound leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The plant typically grows in montane forests and is known for its ornamental value. It produces small, round fruits that are edible and have a sweet, aromatic flavor. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
